channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Extreme heat and humidity are causing 47,000 deaths across Europe—here’s what it does to the human body
item.description: The world’s two hottest days on record happened in July and 2024 is on track to be the warmest year ever.

item.title: Venezuelan opposition protests as election dispute drags on
Why Alphabet might actually benefit from a Google breakup
The NFL could vote soon on letting private equity firms buy stakes in teams
item.description: The league held meetings with multiple private equity firms this week in the hopes of completing a framework to present to owners.

item.title: Blinken to arrive in Israel as U.S. pushes for Gaza ceasefire
item.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is set to arrive in Israel on Sunday as part of Washington's intensifying diplomatic push to achieve a ceasefire in Gaza.

item.title: Kamala Harris wants to ban price gouging by grocers. Some skeptics don't buy it.
U.S. supply chains at risk as Canada’s top railroads begin shutting down networks amid labor dispute
item.description: Canadian Pacific Kansas City and Canadian National railroads have stopped taking certain shipments of hazardous materials and refrigerated products.

item.title: Biden to make a forceful case for Harris and Walz in convention speech
item.description: The outgoing president will make the case for Vice President Kamala Harris to succeed him when he delivers Monday’s keynote address.

item.title: NSYNC could make millions of dollars from newfound ‘Deadpool & Wolverine’ fame
‘Indiana Jones’ fedora fetches $630,000 at auction while ‘Star Wars’ helmet gets $315,000
item.description: The hat featured in 1984's “Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom” was expected to fetch between $250,000 and $500,000, according to the item's online description.

item.title: The first SpaceX spacewalk: What the Polaris Dawn commander says about the bold upcoming mission
item.description: The Polaris Dawn mission is the first of three flights Jared Isaacman bought from SpaceX in 2022 for his human spaceflight effort known as the Polaris Program.

item.title: How the ‘Trump trade’ could shape bitcoin’s course the rest of this year
Goldman Sachs trims recession odds to 20% from 25% on strong data
item.description: If the August jobs report “looks reasonably good, we would probably cut our recession probability back to 15%,” economists led by Jan Hatzius said in a note Saturday.

item.title: Egg prices are rising once again as bird flu limits supply
item.description: Egg prices jumped more than 19% in July compared with the same month a year ago, consumer price index data shows.

item.title: Trump’s ‘No tax on tips’ plan raises questions about Social Security, Medicare
